title: Ambulatory Lead
skills_desc: Consulting, Health Care Provider, Information Technology
description:
ABOUT ELLIT GROUPSEllit Groups is a woman, minority-owned business and certified by WBENC. Provider and Life Sciences organizations are prioritizing diversity and working with firms like Ellit Groups. Diversity in an organization brings strength, differing outlooks and opinions. It helps us be our absolute best. In fact, we strive for it at Ellit Groups. Our leadership are strong believers in this philosophy and intentionally support elevating good people to do their best. We pride ourselves on having top talent with depth and breadth in all we do. Our rapid growth is based on our ability to consistently deliver quality to each customer, ensuring our clients’ success is our success. We have been entrusted to provide an end-to-end IT service delivery model to support running healthcare operations starting with advisory services to planning and implementing some of your most important solutions; supporting them once live; continuing to modernize/optimize the user experience; and offering ongoing learning and adoption of IT solutions.
JOB SUMMARYThe Lead Analyst is accountability for leading cross-functional team(s) across applications and collaborates across other teams and projects. This includes coordinating cross-functional teams and resources across assigned Ellit Groups partner IS, Operations, Vendor(s) and/or other system related functional resources required to implement and support IS projects at the enterprise level. This work may include new applications, modules, and software installations, interface/integration, hardware upgrades, and major application upgrades. This position requires minimal supervision as the individuals are self-starters and take responsibility for the projects assigned under their manager's direction. The Lead Analyst will work closely with physicians, clinical staff, and leadership within assigned Ellit Groups partner IS and Affiliates across the system to provide support, training, and participate in goals/objectives planning and prioritization as it relates to IS applications. The Lead Analyst will prepare status reports; create working design and specification documents, system enhancements and/or modifications requested and approved. The lead analyst will utilize project management tools and techniques to provide project guidance and direction. This position must maintain a familiarity with new and currently installed applications/modules to provide guidance to the team in troubleshooting functionality and providing support and direction on the effective usage and continued growth of the products. This individual must have a thorough understanding of the appropriate business and clinical functions and processes within the organization they support, as well as promote assigned Ellit Groups partner IS initiatives, standards, and build the bridge between assigned Ellit Groups partner IS, Operations, and Vendor(s). 
Responsibilities:Lead the implementation, configuration, and optimization of Epic Ambulatory module in collaboration with cross-functional teams.Serve as the subject matter expert for Ambulatory workflows, functionalities, and best practices.Analyze and assess current workflows, identify areas for improvement, and recommend solutions to enhance system usability and efficiency.Collaborate with clinical stakeholders to understand their needs and translate requirements into actionable system configurations.Provide training and support to end-users to ensure effective utilization of the Epic Ambulatory system.Participate in system upgrades, enhancements, and troubleshooting efforts as needed.Stay current with Epic updates, industry trends, and best practices related to Ambulatory care delivery.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Informatics, Computer Science, or related field.Epic Ambulatory certification required.Minimum of [X] years of experience in Epic Ambulatory implementation, optimization, and support.Strong understanding of Ambulatory clinical workflows and operations.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively engage with clinical and technical stakeholders.Proven ability to lead projects, drive change, and deliver results in a fast-paced healthcare environment.Experience with system configuration, build, and testing methodologies.Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team setting.
Benefits:Ellit Groups provides comprehensive benefits options to salaried employees, including:Medical, Vision, and Dental InsuranceSTD, LTD, and AD&DMedical and Dependent Care FSA401k Retirement6 Paid Holidays and Flexible Paid Time Off
To protect the health and safety of our workforce, clients, patients, and communities we serve, Ellit Groups requires all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some clients require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function. Ellit Groups adheres to all federal, state, and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary documentation from candidates to ensure compliance.
Ellit Groups is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to fostering an inclusive environment. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, Veteran status, disability, any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal laws, rules or regulations. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation for disabilities or special needs. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at recruiting@ellitgroups.com.

title: Client Relations Partner
description:
PRACTICE OVERVIEWRadiology Partners, through its owned and affiliated practices, is a leading radiology practice in the U.S., serving hospitals and other healthcare facilities across the nation. As a physician-led and physician-owned practice, we advance our bold mission by innovating across clinical value, technology, service and economics, while elevating the role of radiology and radiologists in healthcare. Radiology is a team sport, and Radiology Partners is building a community of physicians and support teammates who embody our practice values and believe in our bold mission to transform radiology. Our support team is a vital force within the practice, using their gifts and talents to improve the overall healthcare experience. Using a proven healthcare services model, Radiology Partners provides consistent, high-quality care to patients, while delivering enhanced value to the hospitals, clinics, imaging centers and referring physicians we serve.
POSITION SUMMARYRadiology Partners is seeking a Client Relations Partner accountable for building and managing relationships with client billing teams, managing special projects for Revenue Cycle, and working closely with internal and external billing teams. Encourages communication in the workflow for continuous improvement. The position will focus on managing relationships with billing teams, reviewing metrics and implementing special projects for Revenue Cycle process improvement.
POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESManage relationships with client billing contacts and serve as primary point of contact for questionsIdentify key trends and work with internal and external billing teams to resolve issuesAccountable for reviewing key revenue cycle metrics and working with internal or external billing team to improve resultsLiaise between cross-functional teams- both within Radiology Partners and clients- to ensure optimal delivery of service and client satisfactionCollaborate with billing teams and track implementation of process improvement initiativesLead the development and execution of special projects for the Revenue Cycle teamCoordinate resolution of issues and concerns regarding claims processing and billing issuesMaintains knowledge of and ensures compliance with state and federal laws, regulations for Medicare, Medicaid, managed care and other third party payersManage multiple clients at onceWorks with clients to solve difficult payment problems including claims processing and billing issues across the revenue cycle as well as escalated patient complaintsLead the planning and coordination of meetings
DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEB.A. or B.S. in Business Administration or related field from a four-year College or University preferred5+ years of supervisory experience in revenue cycle in a fast paced, high volume environment2+ years of experience in an A/R consulting roleDemonstrated knowledge of Healthcare reimbursement/collections, medical billing, CPT/ICD9/ICD10 coding, financial reporting and management, with a strong knowledge of the collections processRadiology Revenue Cycle and Billing experience is preferredExcellent inter-personal, verbal, and written communication skillsAdvanced computer skills and proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint required; intermediate skills in MS Word and Outlook requiredDemonstrated ability to successfully lead process improvement projectsExcellent relationship building skills and aptitude for working collaboratively with cross-functional groupsStrong communications skills; ability to listen attentively and to communicate information clearly and effectivelySelf-starter with high degree of drive, initiative, and follow through
Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. RP is committed to being an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment where everyone has equal access and equitable resources to reach their full potential. We are united by our Mission to Transform Radiology and in turn have an important impact on the patients we serve and the healthcare system overall. We hold that diversity is a key source of strength from which we will build a practice culture that is inclusive for all. Our goal is to empower and engage the voice of every teammate to promote awareness, compassion and a healthy respect for differences.
The salary range for this position is $60,000.00 - $75,000.00. Final determinations may vary based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. This role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. In addition to this range, Radiology Partners offers competitive total rewards packages, which include health & wellness coverage options, 401k benefits, and a broad range of other benefits such as family planning and telehealth (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
When you submit a job application or resume, you are providing the Practice with the following categories of personal information that the Practice will use for the purpose of evaluating your candidacy for employment: (1) Personal Identifiers; and (2) Education and Employment History.
Radiology Partners participates in E-verify.

title: Business Development Manager Solutions
description:
Our client is a global provider and manufacturer of industrial HVAC mechanical equipment used in industrial cooling applications for mission critical operations. They help their customers save money by reducing energy and operating costs and provide solutions for modernizing their customer's existing mechanical infrastructure. This company provides cooling solutions to many of the world's largest organizations and government facilities and Enterprise Clients, Colocation Providers and Hyperscale Companies. This career-growth minded opportunity offers exciting projects with leading-edge technology and innovation as well as competitive salaries and benefits.
Business Development Manager - Data Center Cooling Solutions - Dallas, TXOur client is looking for a Commercial HVAC Cooling / Heat Exchange Sales Professional to join their team. The focus is to make a major impact in the mission-critical data center industry across North America. You will also call on Hyperscale / Colo data center customers and upgrade their existing end-of-life mechanical systems with the most cost effective and efficient technology available. The ideal candidate must possess contacts in the Data Center / Critical Facilities / Semi-Conductor Industries. They will call on established clients and prospect for new accounts. The BD Manager is responsible for attaining revenue goals. A proven track record of consultative data center solutions sales skills is a must, along with a strong background in industrial level HVAC Cooling mechanical solutions including Heat Exchangers a big plus!
Responsibilities:Pursue opportunities directly with Data Center End Users / Customers - Colocation Providers, Hyperscale Companies, Enterprise DC's that have upcoming projects in the US with a primary focus of selling data center mechanical cooling solutionsManage relationships with partners, engineering firms, GCs, and client contacts to stay aware of any new / upcoming projectsFPLC – Full project life cycle sales experience – tracking down the opportunity, managing the client, managing the entire project from inception to completion, billing, and collectionsMeet regional sales objectives by forecasting sales, making sales targets and quotas to meet growth objectivesApproach the sale as a consultative solutions sale and cultivate the sale as the sales process could be 6-18 monthsAbility to schedule sales meetings and presentations with qualified decision makers in person or on TeamsResponsible for weekly and monthly reporting to improve pipeline qualification and quality of opportunities pursuedMonitor and discuss the progress of the sales opportunities with sales and senior leadershipResponsible for Scope and Proposal development, perform site surveys and provide scope solutions for customer issuesUtilize the companies CRM tool to track, report, and manage all sales activitiesAttend events data center / critical facilities trade shows and trade association meetings to facilitate networking opportunities – DCD, 7x24 Exchange, DataCenterWorld, BisNow / DICE, etc.
Qualifications:Strong professional network in the Data Center / Critical Facilities Market a must as you will be pursuing opportunities with: Hyperscale, Colo, Enterprise Data Centers Clients, and Semi-conductor ContactsHave an Established network of: Resellers, Engineering Firms, Manufacturer’s Reps, Construction Firms, Design Build, Firms to help foster leads for any future prospective DC ProjectsBusiness Contacts / Rolodex with desired audience: Critical Facility Executives: C Level (as needed), VP of IT, Director of Facilities, Facilities Managers, etc.B/A or B/S a plus5 to 10 yrs.+ of relevant mechanical cooling solution sales experience with cooling towers, chillers, heat exchangersMust be a team player and be able to build long-term cooperative partner relationships with internal and external individuals who are part of the business development processActive members of business organizations such as 7x24 Exchange, DCD, iMasons, AFCOM, ASHRAE, Uptime, Bisnow, etc.Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritizeMust be able to demonstrate a sustained track record of business development accomplishments as related to new business opportunitiesProficient with Customer relationship management platforms (CRM)Proficient with Microsoft Office suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, etc.) a MUSTRequired travel as needed and candidate should be near a major airport
Submittal Instructions:Please apply directly by clicking the link below, alternatively you can forward your resume directly to: 91rozteskcm9ii164ox7h75j6y@crelate.net
To apply directly: https://jobs.crelate.com/portal/pkaza/job/91rozteskcm9ii164ox7h75j6y?crt=1713194063824 
After applying, if you have further questions, you may call 973-895-5200 and ask for Iggy. You can also submit via our career portal and take a look at other Critical Facility openings we are working on at, https://www.pkaza.com/jobs/
If this job is not for you, feel free to forward this along. WE PAY FOR REFERRALS!!
Company offers competitive salaries and benefits package including medical insurance, a 401(k) planEOE/AA Employer M/F/D/VPkaza LLC is a third-party employment firm. All fees assessed by Pkaza LLC will be paid by our employer that we represent and not by the candidate

title: CPA
description:
About Us2Go Products, LLC (DBA LUXE Bidet) is an international direct-to-consumer eCommerce company based in San Diego, California. We design, manufacture, market and sell various consumer products through online retailers like Amazon, Walmart, Target, and Best Buy. It is our mission to provide innovative and affordable items that can upgrade every household. As we expand, we are looking for highly skilled and talented members to join our team to scale growth and optimize operations. We truly believe a collaborative and team oriented environment can deliver extraordinary results. We offer competitive pay and a full benefits package including health insurance, 401k match, on-site gym, fully stocked kitchen, paid time off and holidays, and more. 
About YouWe are looking for an accountant with a CPA to manage financials for an international e-commerce company. You’ll be responsible for preparing, reviewing and analyzing financial reports for our company. Our ideal candidate has in-depth knowledge of bookkeeping, auditing and budgeting procedures. You should be able to monitor daily transactions and recommend ways we can improve our financial health. Previous work experience, along with a degree in Accounting and a CPA qualification is required for this role. Ultimately, you will play a vital role in our company’s financial operations, ensuring compliance with the law and accuracy in accounting.
ResponsibilitiesCreate ad-hoc reports for various business needsPrepare tax documentsCompile and analyze financial statementsManage budgeting and forecastingPerform regular, detailed audits to ensure accuracy in financial documents, expenditures and investmentsMonitor bookkeeping activities regularlyEstablish accounting policies and proceduresStay informed on industry developments and changes in regulations
QualificationsBachelor's degree or higher from reputable institution in Accounting or related fieldIn depth experience with complex accounting such as forensic account, auditing, international accounting, etcAbility to interpret and analyze financial statements and periodicalsThorough knowledge of accounting and financial procedures
2Go Products, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

title: Project Manager
company_name: Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services
description:
Title: Project Manager

State Role Title: Info Technology Specialist III

Hiring Range: Up to $121,000

Pay Band: 6

Agency: Dept Behavioral Health/Develop

Location: Central Office

Agency Website: www.dbhds.virginia.gov

Recruitment Type: General Public - G

Job Duties

The Department of Behavioral Health and Developmental Services’ (DBHDS) IT Project Management Office (PMO) is seeking a highly skilled and trained individual to serve as a Project Manager. This position provides project management oversight and management to technology development and maintenance projects in the PMO. This position may also provide leadership in performing systems analysis and architecting software technology solutions for the agency.

Additional Responsibilities Include

 Meeting regularly with all project staff, stakeholders, and management to coordinate work, resolve issues, remove barriers, and ensure effectiveness and efficiency of all project resources. Working with VITA Project Management Division (PMD) and project sub-contractor organizations and staff to ensure projects are clearly understood by those organizations. Providing appropriate project management for each assigned project following Commonwealth of Virginia standards, agency/PMO procedures, and industry best practices. Project documentation including requirements for project proposals, charters, plans, schedules, cost benefit analyses, and status reporting are properly recorded in approved systems (such as VITA, CTP and SharePoint) within expected timeframes. Developing familiarity with the business needs in an assigned functional area and the environment in which technical solutions will be used. Documenting business unit concerns, business drivers, and strategies and coordinate cross-functional area discussions on enterprise solutions.

Minimum Qualifications

 Knowledge of the associated disciplines of business analysis, software development, quality control, configuration management, technical support, training, and production operations. Knowledge of business process engineering methods. Demonstrated skills in:Microsoft Project to include planning, establishment of critical plans, identification of risks/issues, defect tracking, status reporting, and rescheduling remaining work.Meeting facilitation with customers and technical teams.Utilizing accepted SDLC models and project management methodologies such as Waterfall, Iterative, and Agile. Strong attention to detail, with the ability to follow-through. Excellent facilitation, verbal and written communication, collaboration, negotiation, and presentation skills. Ability to operate effectively in a changing environment with multiple priorities.

Additional Considerations

 Demonstrated experience in organizing, planning, and managing information technology related projects ranging in size/scope from low risk/complexity to high risk/complexity. Project management qualification by the Commonwealth of Virginia, or PMP certification, or equivalent. Experience using project and portfolio management tools. Understanding of and experience with the Commonwealth of Virginia project management standards.

Special Instructions

You will be provided a confirmation of receipt when your application and/or résumé is submitted successfully. Please refer to “Your Application” in your account to check the status of your application for this position.

This position is eligible for telework opportunities; availability, hours, and duration of telework shall be approved as outlined in the Commonwealth telework policy.

For consideration, interested applicants must apply by completing the online application. A resume may also be included with your submission. However, emailed, faxed, and hand-delivered applications and/or resumes will not be accepted. This position is open until filled; however, applications/resumes will begin to be reviewed within seven (7) business days of the date of this posting. Reasonable accommodations are available to persons with disabilities during application and/or interview processes per the Americans with Disabilities Act.

DBHDS welcomes all applicants authorized to work in the U.S. For more information on how to seek this authorization, please refer to Working in the United States or contact the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services office directly.

For any technical assistance with the jobs.virginia.gov website, please contact applicantinquiry@dhrm.virginia.gov.

Contact Information

Name: Keiana Bobbitt

Phone: N/A

Email: keiana.bobbitt@dbhds.virginia.gov - Inquiries Only/No Submissions to include resumes.

In support of the Commonwealth’s commitment to inclusion, we are encouraging individuals with disabilities to apply through the Commonwealth Alternative Hiring Process. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants will need to provide their AHP Letter (formerly COD) provided by the Department for Aging & Rehabilitative Services (DARS), or the Department for the Blind & Vision Impaired (DBVI). Service-Connected Veterans are encouraged to answer Veteran status questions and submit their disability documentation, if applicable, to DARS/DBVI to get their AHP Letter. Requesting an AHP Letter can be found at AHP Letter or by calling DARS at 800-552-5019.

Note: Applicants who received a Certificate of Disability from DARS or DBVI dated between April 1, 2022- February 29, 2024, can still use that COD as applicable documentation for the Alternative Hiring Process.

title: Ansible Deployment Engineer
description:
We are seeking a mission-focused Cloud Deployment Engineer to support cloud systems engineering, administration, and maintenance for a high visibility Executive Branch customer. Your primary focus will be on leveraging Ansible to automate provisioning, configuration management, and deployment in addition to ongoing systems administration, operations, and sustainment support.  This role is hybrid and requires 3 days a week on-site in Washington, DC. Duties, Tasks & ResponsibilitiesLead the implementation, operations, and sustainment of cloud solutions, ensuring they meet industry best practices and comply with FedRAMP requirements.Create Ansible playbooks to automate installation and deployment of cloud resources.Leverage Ansible for automated provisioning, configuration management, and deployment.Migrate existing workloads to cloud (Azure) environment.Manage identities, governance, storage, compute, and virtual networks in a cloud environment, ensuring efficient configuration and management.Monitor and optimize performance of cloud solutions to ensure efficient operations.Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to infrastructure, hardware failures, network issues, and performance bottlenecks.Provide domain expertise to support the engineering, implementation, and sustainment of cloud solutions, encryption solutions, and supporting technology products in support of the organization’s cloud security objectives.Create and maintain architecture diagrams and documentation for all cloud solutions.
Required Experience, Education, Skills & TechnologiesBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Computer Engineering or Information Technology or equivalent degree (or additional 4 years of experience in lieu of degree).Active DoD TS/SCI Clearance or TS with SCI eligibility 9+ years of related experienceExperience using Ansible for automated provisioning, configuration management, and deployment of cloud workloads (Azure environment preferred).Experience creating Ansible playbooks (YAML) for automated configuration of Azure resources.Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies & services with demonstrated hands-on experience in performing systems engineering activities in cloud environments.Proficiency in PowerShell and/or Azure CLI.Strong background in IT infrastructure fundamentals, including networking, storage, and security.Knowledge of networking concepts, including TCP/IP, VLANs, and routing protocols.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

title: Medical Practice Manager
description:
JOB SUMMARY:Oversees daily operations of a primary care office to ensure that the office is running smoothly and as cost effectively as possible. Understands and upholds the practice philosophy of health care and integrates this philosophy into daily functions. Provides information and assistance to internal and external customers.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:ManagementLead team members and promote Aylo Health’s mission, values, and goals.Implement and ensure quality measures, compliance, and practice policies are being met.Supervise, assign, and direct activities of team members based on trends and opportunities identified by reviewing reports, direct observations, and feedback.Communicate effectively both verbally and written with all team members, patients, and vendors.
Patient ExperienceLead Aylo patient experience culture; demonstrate empathy and concern for our patients.Answer internal and external customer/patient inquires, and handle patient relations issues in accordance with practice policies and procedures.Identify and address patient/team member concerns in a timely manner.Provide team members with personalized patient experience feedback and coaching.
Team Building/Staff DevelopmentInterview, hire and on-board new team members; conduct and/or coordinate new team member orientation training.Oversee continued development of existing team members and required trainings.Conduct performance evaluations for all assigned personnel.Coach and execute counseling discussions with all assigned personnel.
OperationsManage staffing/team member schedules to meet patient demand.Monitor patient appointment schedules, wait times, and process of treating patients in a timely fashion; review EMR for errors and omissions to ensure efficiency and identify opportunities for improvement.Monitor, adjust, and approve team member time records.Report any technical, mechanical, or electrical issues as well as patient area maintenance needs or problems.Responsible for inventory management.Perform daily cash deposits with appropriate documentation.Oversee collection of co-pays, deductibles, and other outstanding patient balances at the time of service.Audit work performed by office staff, as needed.Order office and clinical supplies.Ensure cash deposits are made daily, attaching the appropriate documentation.Audit work performed by office staff, as needed.
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:High School graduate or equivalent required3-5 yrs. experience in management role in a primary care settingMust have valid driver’s license and able to travel to all locationsAbility to be flexible with work schedule (could require working evenings, weekends, and holidays)Excellent communication skillsAbove average problem-solving skillsComputer literate with entry level working knowledge of Microsoft Suites; Outlook, Word Demonstrated ability to organize, coordinate, prioritize, and facilitate many on-going tasks at one timeDuties require professional verbal and written communication skillsSuperior problem-solving skills; ability to identify service delivery issues and develop timely solutions.

title: Account Executive
description:
Acra Lending is hiring for Account Executives in Phenix, AZ
This position is responsible for developing a plan for bringing mortgage brokers onboard, maintaining an active sales pipeline, and complete documentation for all broker and loan approvals.
Responsibilities:• Become a subject matter expert, knowledgeable in all Acra Lending products and programs, basic eligibility parameters, and pricing• Develop and execute an effective prospecting plan for bringing mortgage brokers onboard• Prepare call lists and take appropriate actions to draw in and sustain business• Win business through deepening contact networks within new and existing accounts• Submit clean and complete documentation for all broker and loan approvals• Maintain an up-to-date sales pipeline• Other duties as assigned

Preferred but not required• High school diploma recipient• Knowledge and understanding of Microsoft office products, word, excel, outlook, PowerPoint, etc.• Knowledge and understanding of web search via popular search engines, Google, Bing, etc.• Aggressive, go-getter attitude and epic closing skills
Credentials and Experience Required:• Sales experience is required• Mortgage experience strongly preferred• Current and non-restricted driver’s license and adequate car insurance
Based upon location, experience, education, and qualifications, AE’s make a base of $24,840- $27,600 annually

The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and abilities required in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

title: Senior Network Security Engineer
description:
Mspark, a B2C marketing services company, specializes in driving Rural Market brand growth and customer engagement strategies for national and local advertisers. By combining consumer and marketplace data, we craft coordinated campaigns using a seamless mix of shared mail, direct mail, trigger-based marketing, and digital advertising solutions such as display, retargeting, and Mobile ID tracking that drive the right audience behavior to achieve your marketing goals.
The Senior Network Security Engineer will provide all aspects of planning, implementation, and support for Mspark’s computer and network infrastructure.
Responsibilities: The role includes supporting the organization's network and server infrastructure and ensuring connectivity for all employees and locations.Work closely with departmental peers to ensure the organization’s systems and data security.Initiates and fosters partnerships with key stakeholders to better understand the primary objectives of the business unit to proactively improve upon or develop new solutions through technology.Implement security measures to protect systems, networks, and data.Work as part of the IT Operations Department, regularly interacting with Developers, other IT Engineers, and the IT Help Desk as needed to troubleshoot and resolve production issues.Leadership role in the planning and testing disaster recovery and business continuity plans and exercises.Follow best logical and physical security practices to improve the company’s security posture continually.Monitor and support all network equipment, maintaining current code levels.Lead role in the organization’s patch management process.Installing, updating, and configuring security infrastructure and other security measures.Respond to security incidents and assist with incident response plans.Occasional after-hours support and travel are required for preventative maintenance, break/fix activities, and project work.Other Duties as assigned.
What we're looking for:Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical degree.8+ years’ experience as a network engineer implementing and supporting large enterprise networks.Hands-on experience installing and supporting enterprise routers, switches, and firewalls.Hands-on experience installing and supporting virtualized environments that support Windows and Linux operating systems.Experience installing and Supporting SDWAN Technologies.Experience installing and supporting network storage equipment (NAS, SAN)Excellent communication skills with the ability to speak on varying technical levels.Self-starter who can work independently on complex IT projects.Experience installing and configuring Firewalls.Experience installing and maintaining Network Monitoring and Alerting Products.Experience deploying and maintaining secure wireless network configurations.Experience working with cloud architecture and infrastructure.

title: Maintenance and Reliability Manager
description:
Position OverviewAs Maintenance & Reliability Manager, you will be responsible for all maintenance operations, including equipment safety, maximizing machine productivity and uptime, as well as the condition and upkeep of the facility.  The Maintenance & Reliability Manager will maintain and improve performance of the company’s physical assets and control maintenance labor and material costs to achieve plant performance goals. This position will require considerable interaction with plant floor personnel, leadership teams, engineering, external support, and contractors.  Key Functions Develop and manage all maintenance activities, with safety being the highest priority. Lead preventive & predictive maintenance/process reliability, manage improvement of key performance indicators, continuous improvement of maintenance functions, and department budget cost effectiveness. Responsible for the development and training of technicians including coaching, mentoring and development. Participate and/or lead initiatives for capital projects and problem-solving activities. Assure purchasing and storeroom functions follow established policies and procedures. Play a key role in supporting, maintaining, and improving processes associated with the computerized maintenance management system for process reliability. Lead team meetings & trainings, identify safety, environmental, quality & production issues, coordinate activities with the production team to maximize productivity, minimize cost and reduce waste. Take measures to proactively address all concerns.
 AccountabilitiesManage the integrity and maintenance of all plant assets, including production equipment, facilities, utility equipment, and grounds.Establish departmental goals that maintain focus on improving line efficiencies, product quality, and equipment reliability.Strong focus on ergonomics and employee safety during both the planning and execution of capital projects.Emphasis on the development and enforcement of plant safety policies related to LOTO, confined space, electrical, and other industrial safety hazards.Implement predictive maintenance strategies to increase reliability and increase planned maintenance activity.Support the efficient operation of the plant through effective utilization of engineering and facility maintenance resources.Develop ideas and projects to reduce utility and energy costs.Determine equipment capabilities for new or revised factory layouts.Participate on the Food Safety and HACCP Team.Develop and foster a communication network that promotes interaction between maintenance, operations, sanitation, team leaders, and managers.Create a proactive work environment that involves mechanics in the planning, coordinating, and execution of work.Develop expertise in the maintenance organization on all mechanical, electrical, and controls platforms.Utilize the companies EAM system to maximize wrench time and improve equipment reliability.Determine skills gaps in the maintenance team and develop education/training plans to close those gaps.Minimum Qualifications · High School Diploma/GED (or higher) Minimum of 7 years at a high-speed automation process or manufacturing operation with increasing responsibility in a leadership role such as maintenance supervision, maintenance management, maintenance engineering, reliability engineering, or plant/facilities management /engineering.· A passion for safety and exceptional leadership capability in improving safety performance. · Knowledgeable in the areas of title: Senior Accountant
description:
Are you looking to work for a company that has been recognized for over a decade as a Top Place to Work? Apply today to become a part of a company that continues to commit to putting our employees first.

Job Description:

Position Summary: Provides financial support to the organization and its clients. Ensures the integrity of accounting information and transactions, applies principles of accounting to analyze financial information, and prepares financial reports.

COMPETENCIES/Role-Specific Functions: 

COMMUNICATION 

Communicates well both verbally and in writing, creates accurate and punctual reports, delivers presentations, shares information and ideas with others, has good listening skills.

Develops and maintains constructive and cooperative working relationships with others; communicates financial information to supervisors, co-workers, teams, and clients. 

PROBLEM SOLVING

Breaks down problems into smaller components, understands underlying issues, can simplify and process complex issues, understands the difference between critical details and unimportant facts.

Audits own work for accuracy and completeness, and reviews accounting systems for efficiency, effectiveness, and use of accepted accounting procedures to record transactions. Promotes and participates in accounting process standardization and process improvement. Troubleshoots errors and issues, provides solutions and communicates resolution or change. 

PROJECT MANAGEMENT 

Establishes project goals, milestones, and procedures, defines roles and responsibilities, acquires project resources, coordinates projects throughout company, monitors project progress, manages multiple projects.

Establishes realistic deadlines for completion of month and year end accounting procedures, updates deadlines if necessary, and communicates progress to supervisors and accounting team. Identifies duplication of tasks and coordinates with the accounting team to reduce duplication. Establishes deadlines and milestones for process improvement. Works with team to implement recommendations. 

MENTORING/TRAINING

Acting as subject matter expert for the team and the ‘go to’ person for questions and answers. Delivering formal and informal training on day to day objectives within the team.

Identifies areas where team members can improve and provides training. Reviews the work product for accuracy. 

CUSTOMER FOCUS

Builds customer confidence, is committed to increasing customer satisfaction, sets achievable customer expectations, assumes responsibility for solving customer problems, ensures commitments to customers are met, solicits opinions and ideas from customers, responds to customers.

Analyzes business operations, trends, costs, revenues, financial commitments and obligations to project future revenues and expenses and to provide interpretation and advice. Listens to the business needs of customers, internal or external, and provides recommendations for achieving their requests. Creates a process that meets the customers’ needs and follows up to ensure their business needs are met. Advises customers on their budgets and reviews budgets for correct coding and accuracy. 

JOB KNOWLEDGE

Understands duties and responsibilities, has necessary job knowledge, has necessary technical skills, understands company mission/values, keeps job knowledge current, is in command of critical issues.

Develops, maintains and analyzes budgets, preparing periodic and/or ad-hoc reports that compare budgeted costs to actual costs. Maintains general ledger systems and related processes, including but not limited to accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, cash management and journal entries. Checks and verifies entry data for completeness and accuracy; codes regular entries for distribution to accounts. Flexibility to change focus regarding clients, etc. Ability to adapt/change. Reviews transactions for completeness, accuracy and proper authorization. Checks and verifies regular entry detail for accounts payable and accounts receivable, prepares bank deposits, posts data to registers and ledgers, totals and reconciles incoming cash and disbursements. Prepares, analyzes and verifies reports, financial statements and other records to assess financial condition and facilitate planning. Partake in financial audits / reviews. Initiate innovation and process improvements and implementation. Other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications (Education/Experience/Knowledge/Skills):

Bachelors’ Degree with emphasis in Accounting. Five years accounting experience in a health care environment required. Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles, accounting processes and practices, basic internal accounting controls, and the analysis and reporting of financial data. Knowledge of the financial markets, banking and economic principles and practices. Skill in identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. Skill in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Skill in understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making. Skill in considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one. Able to use office and accounting software, including Microsoft Office software in a Windows environment, MS Dynamics GP, Management Reporter, Integration Manager and QuickBooks, and learn new software as required. Able to communicate information effectively, written and oral, so that others will understand and in a way suitable for the specific audience. Ability to prioritize daily tasks with ad hoc requests and special projects. Home office that is HIPAA compliant for all remote or telecommuting positions as outlined by the company policies and procedures. 

Salary Range:

$73,093- $91,366

title: Maintenance Supervisor
description:
Founded in 1923, The Yarco Companies, is a full-service, multi-family real estate firm that delivers highly specialized Property Management Services, and focuses primarily on Affordable Housing. To learn more about our company visit www.yarco.com.

Yarco is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, color, sex, national origin, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or physical or mental disability. In compliance with the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, we will hire only U.S. citizens and aliens lawfully authorized to work in the United States (if the position is or will be one which is subject to U.S. law).

Position Purpose:

This safety sensitive position is responsible for maintenance of the residential apartment’s homes, public space, outside grounds and equipment. Supervise and manage all employees connected with these areas to ensure adherence to company guidelines and achieve excellent customer satisfaction.

Each community location has pre-designated office hours which this position will need to accompany to ensure community operations are functioning effectively

Purchasing/Maintenance Inventory: Maintain proper amount of parts and supplies in-stock in a well organized and clean manner following the purchasing guidelines of the company.

Perform other duties as needed.

Education: High school diploma or GED required. Pool and HVAC certification preferred, boiler certification if appropriate.

Experience: Three plus years maintenance experience in residential property experience.

title: Fixed Asset Accountant
description:
Want to see more? Find all job opportunities for both BioFire and bioMérieux worldwide by clicking here.

Description

Position Summary:

This role is responsible for Fixed Asset accounting (non-install base). This role will ensure all fixed asset data is accurate, calculate use tax on appropriate purchases, and ensure timely and accurate capitalization of fixed assets. This role will partner with business functions to ensure that projects are validated and capitalized at the appropriate time. This role will provide fixed asset schedules for monthly and quarterly financial reporting as well as tax schedules and insurance schedules. This role will conduct annual fixed asset inventory/prepare the annual impairment memo, prepare budget and any fixed asset data as required.

Primary Responsibilities

Perform all work in compliance with company policy and within the guidelines of bioMérieux Finance Processes and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles. Maintain accurate and up-to-date Fixed Asset addition, retirement, disposal, sale, impairment and depreciation information for all non install base assets. Maintain locations available for the physical location field within the 028 Fixed Asset Database. Maintain the AUC account for 028 to ensure additions and disposals are accurate and managed timely. Prepare/review a monthly rollforward report for 028. Ensure deadlines are met and all fixed assets are timely and accurately accounted for 028. Ensure the CIP account is cleared timely and accurately for entity 028. Plan, organize, and compile data for the annual internal fixed asset physical inventory count and impairment testing review. Prepare the written impairment report and recommendations. Ensure all CAPEX additions are approved and posted to correct General Ledger Accounts, Cost Centers and/or Project (if applicable) according to accounting guidelines and departmental instructions. Ensure all purchases are approved and supported with CAPEX bids and appropriate e-requestor approvals. Responsible for maintaining all Fixed Asset records and files in SAP. Lead and support the activities related to budget preparation/submission and Strat Plan by delivering a fixed asset addition reporting as well as depreciation forecast for both activities. Coordinate input and changes with all functional groups and entities in the North American scope to ensure accuracy and completeness. Perform the depreciation run in SAP for each period end close. Be responsible for submitting and reconciling the Corporate reporting tools (AFO, COFIS and Fixed Asset Rollforward) to ensure alignment. Provide all appropriate Fixed Asset reports (as requested) for month, quarter and year-end close, reconcile Fixed Asset sub-ledger accounts and General Ledger Accounts as assigned. Provide support for internal and external audits as required. Responsible for month-end close activities and related journal entries as required. 

Education, Skills, & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field with 5+ years of accounting experienceExperience in a manufacturing environment preferred Experience with Fixed Asset accounting in an ERP system (SAP) preferred but not required. 
BioFire Diagnostics, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.

Please be advised that the receipt of satisfactory responses to reference requests and the provision of satisfactory proof of an applicant’s identity and legal authorization to work in the United States are required of all new hires. Any misrepresentation, falsification, or material omission may result in the failure to receive an offer, the retraction of an offer, or if already hired, dismissal. If you are a qualified individual with a disability, you may request a reasonable accommodation in BioFire Diagnostics’ application process by contacting us via telephone at (385) 770-1132, by email at [email protected], or by dialing 711 for access to Telecommunications Relay Services (TRS).

title: Business Analyst - Governance & Reporting
description:
Western & Southern is looking for a dynamic candidate who has both business analysis and project management experience to actively participate in the development and maturation of our Program Management Office (PMO). The PMO Governance & Reporting team partners across the W&S enterprise to provide services and support with all aspects of the PMO’s portfolio, program, and project management governance practices. This role provides with collaboration opportunities across the enterprise while bringing your BA and PM expertise into solutioning and developing best practices. You will coach and collaborate with others to drive results. You will be a change agent and an advocate for Centers of Excellence (COEs) and Communities of Practice (COPs) to provide leadership and support others in their career growth and development.
Are you self-initiating? Do you build and maintain strong working relationships with multiple stakeholders? Do you enjoy being part of a team as well as a contributing individually? This may be the role for you.
Duties and Responsibilities:Delivery of PMO governance and reportingExecution on visions, goals, priorities and values across the enterprise, IT, and the PMODevelop and maintain strong relationships to drive results and deliver services as neededMonitor, track, and develop meaningful measures and metric in support of portfolios, programs, and projectsDevelop, document, and train new and existing procedures and processesLeverage business analysis and project management expertise to define and enhance best practicesDrive results while holding self and others accountable for high-quality delivery and rapid execution across the enterprise
Requirements:At least 10 years of experience assisting with the execution of program and project management and/or PMO governance and reporting.Demonstrated ability to define, track, and report on metrics used to identify process outcomes and improve performance.Proven ability to develop training materials and to train both business and IT associates in new processes.Proven experience in mentoring and coaching in program and portfolio management governance, quality control tracking, process training, and metrics development and reporting.Demonstrated use of strong listening, communication and presentation techniques. Verbal and written communications are to conform to proper rules of punctuation, grammar, diction and style.Demonstrated experience leading and completing assigned tasks accurately and in a timely manner.Proven analytical/problem-solving/critical-thinking skills.Demonstrated adaptability when required to adjust to multiple demands/deadlines, shifting priorities, ambiguity and rapid change.Excellent attention to detail

title: Commercial Product Manager
description:
Hastings Mutual is currently looking for a Commercial Product Manager to join our Product Development team! This is a great opportunity for an experienced Property & Casualty Insurance professional to provide sound analysis and recommendations regarding new and existing product offerings.
Position OverviewThe Commercial Product Manager analyzes and recommends rates, rules, forms, and guidelines for existing products as well as new ones for assigned product areas. This position also ensures all existing products comply with state statutes and current court decisions.
Position Location & Work Format This position is flexible in its location! Candidates residing within the greater Hastings, Michigan, will be able to work a hybrid (combination of on-site and work-from-home) schedule as an alternative. Preference will also be given to candidates who reside within our six-state territory (Michigan, Indiana, Illinois, Wisconsin, Iowa, or Illinois). Hastings Mutual may consider candidates in other states to work remotely if elements of their application are strong. Generally, this role will work within our standard office hours of Monday - Friday, 8:00 am - 4:30 pm.
Position Duties & ResponsibilitiesUnderstands the assigned markets and develops specific strategies related to price, product, and underwriting.Identifies opportunities to enhance existing products and services to improve financial performance and to better align with competitive markets.Designs, develops, and manages new and existing products from initial conception through service delivery.Reviews product performance and outcomes based on cost and benefit analyses and makes recommendations for product improvements.Directs the implementation of product revisions including coordination with other departments on a timely basis.Monitors market trends to identify new product opportunities and enhancements to existing products.Ensures required action for timely regulatory review and approval of products and activities including form design and overseeing insurance department submissions.Researches, develops, and recommends formal product proposals consisting of rating variable analysis, coverage comparisons, and rate indications, to support specific business segment and product objectives.Work with the Actuarial team to development and recommend pricing strategies and analyze the impacts of those strategies.Gains approval of the cross-functional team for the proposed changes.Plans and approves communications regarding changes.Implements ongoing internal and external product training to improve product outcomes.Coordinates the development of, and changes to, underwriting guidelines, product eligibility rules, and underwriting manuals.Consults with Legal to ensure compliance with state laws and regulations relative to rate, rules, and forms.Prepares rate, rule, and form filings using SERFF (System of Electronic Rate and Form Filing).Responds to insurance department objections along with the actuarial team.Initiates and approves requirements for changes to necessary databases and systems within HMIC policy administration systems for newly developed rates and algorithms.Reviews tests of rates and algorithms to ensure accuracy.Serves as subject matter expert and consultant for other departments relative to programming, statistical reporting, claims, and underwriting for assigned products.Performs periodic audits on assigned products.Maintains forms indexes for assigned product lines.Serves on interdepartmental special project committees.Actively participates in professional development, i.e. continuing education or self-improvement.Other duties as assigned by leadership, either verbally or in writing.
Candidate Requirements & QualificationsBachelor’s or advanced degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, or Insurance, or a related degree, or equivalent work experience required.Five years minimum experience in property and casualty insurance with a background in underwriting, claims, product development, or marketing.Demonstrated understanding of the pricing and product management process, including exposure to rating and coverage forms, is required.CPCU designation or other insurance-related coursework, or actuarial exams are preferred.Demonstrated math and statistical aptitude.Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication ability.Demonstrated PC skills including proficient use of Microsoft Office products.Effective organization and teamwork skills.
Our Commitment as an EmployerWe value the strength of a diverse and inclusive workforce. Hastings Mutual is committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and candidates in a work environment that does not tolerate any form of discrimination or harassment. Decisions related to employment are based on business needs, position requirements, and individual characteristics without regard to appearance, nationality, origin, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, body, disability, veteran, family, marital status, or any legally protected class.
Hastings Mutual seeks to provide reasonable accommodation to disabled individuals in the hiring process in compliance with federal, state, and local law. Candidates requiring an accommodation to complete their job application or participate in the interviewing process are asked to notify the Talent Acquisition Specialist or contact us at 800-442-8277.
About Hastings Mutual Insurance CompanyFrom our humble roots in 1885, providing coverage for windstorm damage, Hastings Mutual has evolved into a leading regional property and casualty insurance carrier, offering innovative products for businesses, farm owners, and individuals. We work with customers in six Midwestern states (Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Ohio, and Wisconsin). Hastings Mutual is known for its financial strength, high ethical standards, and culture of service and responsiveness.

The core of our ongoing success is our employees. Whether at the corporate offices in Hastings, Michigan, to our remote team members throughout the Midwest, Hastings Mutual is made up of talented professionals across multiple divisions and functional areas. Our commitment to our employees and work culture has been confirmed with our inclusion in the “Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in West Michigan” each year since 2011.

Hastings Mutual offers a friendly, family-like environment that values transparency and approachability. We recognize the hard work of our employees with many benefits, including fully paid certification training, a cafeteria, and fitness center at our corporate offices, ongoing professional development opportunities, and financial stability backed by our “A” rating from A.M. Best. We also have a long-term commitment to the communities in which we live and work, either through partnerships with local charitable organizations or through our own Hastings Mutual Charitable Foundation.

At Hastings Mutual, we’re always looking for professionals of all experience and education levels to help us continue our more than 130-year history of successful, stable growth.

title: Senior Media Buyer
description:

title: Instructional Designer
description:

audience’s training needs.State instructional end goals and create content that matches them.Visualize instructional graphics, the user interface, and the finished product.Conduct instructional research and analysis on learners and contexts.Provide exercises and activities that enhance the learning process.Responsible for working directly with Managers, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs),Learning and Development Specialists and other project team members to design, develop and deliver training and development solutions using multiple delivery mediums including but not limited to classroom instruction, eLearning, video, job aids, and other related methods and techniques.Responsible for conducting the analysis, design, development, and evaluation of eLearning, classroom learning (live and virtual), blended learning, and informal learning.Plan, organize, and develop training curricula, materials, and programs to meet specific learning needs.Work closely with subject matter experts to learn and understand needs.Conduct needs assessments and training program design strategies to develop programs and curricula that are responsive to current business needs, multiple skill levels and learning theory.Ensure that learning solutions align with organizational goals and priorities.Work creatively to build engaging curriculum using a variety of methods (eLearning, classroom, assessments, etc.).Apply instructional design theories, standards, and best practices to produce effective learning and development solutions while maximizing quality and minimizing cost.Develop and manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables according to approved project plans.Manage relationships with key stakeholders to evaluate and assess the success of the delivered content.Analyze training trends and business needs by examining learner's satisfaction levels, proficiency testing and job performance metrics.Analyze the emerging learning technology environment to continue to drive design and development within the teams.Learn and apply new technologies to the design, development, and delivery of online learning, including audio, video, and animation.Coordinate with outside contractors and vendors as required.

title: Associate Research Director
company_name: Penn Arts & Sciences, University of Pennsylvania
description:
Job Description SummaryThe Associate Research Director of the Penn Initiative for the Study of Markets (PISM) is responsible for managing financial operations and the administration of the center including grant proposal preparation, financial record-keeping, and budget management, ensuring compliance and accuracy. They will also support academic programming by assisting with departmental needs, organizing events, and providing research support. Finally, the position manages donor relations by meeting with donors to discuss research initiatives and providing concise summaries of activities.
Job DescriptionMarkets matter greatly. Historical experience suggests that societies that embrace open markets prosper. There is no historical example of enduring and broad prosperity in a nation without them. Open and working markets are taken for granted, or worse, they are abused or attacked for short-term economic and/or political gains. Against that backdrop, many schools and universities fail to equip future leaders and decision-makers with a fact-based view of the subject free from ideology.
The Penn Initiative for the Study of the Markets (PISM) aims to address that failure. We strive to raise awareness of the importance of markets and their philosophical foundations - based on facts, critical thinking, and non-partisan perspectives - with the goal of reaching a wide audience of scholars and students.
Our goals:Create a world-class undergraduate program at the University of Pennsylvania.Become a magnet for young promising scholars in the fields of political economy, economic history, and applied price theory to do research at PennAttract prominent economists as lecturers and visiting professors.Become an authority on the importance of markets, generating course materials for high school and college classes.Change the public’s attitudes and opinions regarding the importance of markets.
Key Responsibilities:
Financial Management:Prepare and submit grant proposals, ensuring accuracy and compliance with grant requirements.Maintain detailed records and summaries of grant activities and results to fulfill reporting obligations.Assist the business office with the processing and monitoring of PISM’s finances and operations.Manage the accounting for the center.Complete budget preparations.
Academic Responsibilities:Prepare motivation, literature review, research design, proposed econometric analysis, and expected outcomes of grant proposals.Assist with academic programming for political science and academics as applicable to the department needs.Read academic papers for department events to determine the speakers and participants.Support research needs for Latin America projects.
Donor Relations:Meet with donors to discuss the research being done and how the grants are being utilized.Create concise summaries of events and academic activities for donors and stakeholders.
Administrative Tasks:Perform administrative duties to support the smooth functioning of the center, including scheduling meetings, managing correspondence, and maintaining databases.Organize and manage the initiative’s events (marketing, logistics, and accounting).

Qualifications:
Required:Master’s degree and 3 to 5 years of experience required.Experience in a financial setting and proficiency in accounting principles and budget preparations.Experience in higher education administration and strong organizational and administrative skills.Demonstrated experience and success in writing and submitting grant proposals.Demonstrated interested in political science and/or economics.Comfortability with the Spanish language as much of the work centers around Latin America.
Preferred:Ph.D. in Economics, Political Theory, or related field.Fluency in Spanish is preferred.
This position is contingent upon continued grant funding.
Salary offers are made based on the candidate’s qualifications, experience, skills, and education as they directly relate to the requirements of the position, as well as internal and market factors and grade profile. 
Affirmative Action Statement Penn adheres to a policy that prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected class.
Special Requirements Background check required after a conditional job offer is made. Consideration of the background check will be tailored to the requirements of the job.
University BenefitsHealth, Life, and Flexible Spending Accounts: Penn offers comprehensive medical, prescription, behavioral health, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits to protect you and your family’s health and welfare. You can also use flexible spending accounts to pay for eligible health care and dependent care expenses with pre-tax dollars.Tuition: Take advantage of Penn's exceptional tuition benefits. You, your spouse, and your dependent children can get tuition assistance here at Penn. Your dependent children are also eligible for tuition assistance at other institutions.Retirement: Penn offers generous retirement plans to help you save for your future. Penn’s Basic, Matching, and Supplemental retirement plans allow you to save for retirement on a pre-tax or Roth basis. Choose from a wide variety of investment options through TIAA and Vanguard.Time Away from Work: Penn provides you with a substantial amount of time away from work during the course of the year. This allows you to relax, take vacations, attend to personal affairs, recover from illness or injury, spend time with family—whatever your personal needs may be.To learn more, please visit: https://www.hr.upenn.edu/PennHR/benefits-pay

title: Associate Account Executive
description:
Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services. 
Calculated Hire was established in 2015 to provide human capital solutions to our clients by merging technology and business strategy. Our team takes a relationship-based, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 clients to help them solve their human capital challenges. We are not just in the business of consulting services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our employees and externally with our clients and consultants.
RESPONSIBILITIESAssociate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a relationship-driven, client-focused approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. title: Sales Enablement Trainer
description:
At Generac, our people help make the world safer, brighter and more productive. We are united by our efforts to inspire change for a better world; impact our people and community; influence and achieve positive results; and innovate the industry. Our shared goals allow people with diverse backgrounds and points of view to work together, bringing our global customers peace of mind through reliable products and exceptional support.
Job Summary: The Sales Enablement Trainer is responsible for the delivery and administration of best-in-class training to engage key audiences across the Consumer Power business and omni-channel distribution partners in support of the organization’s topline revenue goals. Classes include product feature/benefits stories, sales techniques, and critical program elements designed to develop and grow the omni-channel business. The Sales Enablement Trainer will work closely with multiple departments to coordinate training sessions that ensure maximum efficiency and productivity. 
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Coordinate with manager to align training initiatives and coaching with business goals Responsible for maintaining a deep level understanding of Generac programs and processes and simplifying the material into comprehensive training programCollaborate cross-functionally to assess sales training needs for salespeople and sales leaders; work with stakeholders to update and improve the sales training program Conduct train-the-trainer sessions with external sales teams and owns external vendor relationships as neededProject manages curriculum, courses, class schedules, and updates as needed Hosting online seminars, instructor lead training and one-on-one coachingConduct training program evaluations: communicate key performance indicators and report results to stakeholders; identify opportunities to continuously improve and execute updatesStay up to date on industry best practices, sales methodologies, and adult learning principles to continually enhance the product and sales training program Constantly inspect performance, using quantitative and qualitative observations to identify gaps and continuous learning opportunities and actionsUtilizes competitive insights, industry trends, and customer feedback to drive optimization and adoption of industry best practices
Minimum Qualifications:High School Diploma plus 5 years work experience3+ years of experience in sales enablement, training or experience working with sales teams or mentoring and coaching3+ years of experience in sales or customer support environmentAbility to travel up to 30% and a valid Driver's License
Preferred Qualifications:Proven history of delivering impactful training programs and fostering a culture of continuous learningExpert-level knowledge of the sales processExperience navigating a fast-paced environmentProficient in Microsoft products including Word, Excel, Power BI, PowerPoint; additional experience with LMS programs a plus
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Strong background in sales, exceptional training, and communication skillsPassion for helping individuals grow and developComfort working in a fast-paced environmentAbility to be proactive, self-motivated and self-directingA can-do, positive attitude and a strong desire to get things doneDesire to be a team player and work together to empower the sales teams to perform at their bestAbility to work well under pressure and meet deadlinesExceptional interpersonal skills and ability to develop strong working relationshipsPassion and preference empower the sales teams to perform at their bestB2B and B2C experience is preferred
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion, the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend, or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision, and the ability to adjust focus. Up to 30% travel and valid Driver’s License required.
